      • findVarAccessOtherThanFutureDefinition

        public static java.util.List<CtStatement> findVarAccessOtherThanFutureDefinition(<any> block,
                                                                                 <any> element)
        Finds the occurrence of a future variable within the block of that future variable. However, this only finds the first occurrence of that future variable, and not the others.
        Parameters:
        block -
        element -
        Returns:

      • getDeclarationStatement

        public static CtStatement getDeclarationStatement(CtStatement currentStatement,
                                                  java.lang.String argName)
        Finds and returns the declaration statement of an argument that has been used within another statement.
        Parameters:
        currentStatement - : CtStatement, the statement, in which the variable is used.
        argName - : String, the name of the variable, for which we are looking for the declaration.
        Returns:
        CtStatement, declaring statement

      • isFutureVariable

        public static boolean isFutureVariable(<any> currentDeclaredElement,
                                       java.lang.String argName)
        Indicates if an argument that is used at the time of the declaration of another element is itself a future variable or not. If yes, then its name is replaced by its taskInfo equivalent.
        Parameters:
        currentDeclaredElement - : CtLocalVariable, the annotated element that is currently being processed by spoon processor.
        argName - : String, the name of the element being investigated.
        Returns:
        true, if the argument is a future variable, false otherwise.

      • isTaskIDReplacement

        public static boolean isTaskIDReplacement(<any> element,
                                          java.lang.String name)
        Indicates if an object represents the taskID object of a task that has been declared before the statement that is currently being processed by spoon processor. Considering that spoon processes elements in order of appearance, if a taskInfo has been created, and its values replaced by taskID.getReturnResult(), then it must be declared before, and hence processed before the current element being processed.
        Parameters:
        element - : CtLocalVariable, the local variable declaration that is annotated, and is currently being processed by spoon.
        name - : String, the name of the variable that is being inspected.
        Returns:
        true if the variable is replace by a taskID object, false otherwise.
